section.title: Changing min-part-hours in Swift
section.para: The min-part-hours parameter specifies the number of hours you must wait before Swift will allow a given partition to be moved. In other words, it constrains how often you perform ring rebalance operations. Before changing this value, you should get some experience with how long it takes your system to perform replication after you make ring changes (for example, when you add servers).
See for more information about determining when replication has completed.

section.title: Changing the min-part-hours Value
section.para: To change the min-part-hours value, following these steps:

listitem.para: Edit your ~/openstack/my_cloud/definition/data/swift/swift_config.yml file and change the value(s) of min-part-hours for the rings you desire. The value is expressed in hours and a value of zero is not allowed.
Commit your configuration to the local Git repository (), as follows:
listitem.screen: &prompt.ardana;cd ~/openstack/ardana/ansible &prompt.ardana;git add -A &prompt.ardana;git commit -m "My config or other commit message"
